Posts.Content: bachambault wrote: Should I worry that I am at a higher risk of breast cancer in the future if my biopsy showed extensive scleorsing adenosis, mucinous spherulosis, intraductal hyperplasia, papillomatosis and columnar cell hyperplasia. Numerous microcalcifications seen throughout the specimen. Also If I am what can I do to limit my risk factors. Thank you Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: would this put you in high risk cancer group bachambault awb

Posts.Content: bachambault wrote: I found out I have a radial scar and they want to remove it, if it is b9 couldn't they just recheck in a few months instead?   I got a copy of pathology report and it said Proliferative fibrocystic changes with radial scar, extensive sclerosing adenosis and mucinous spherulosis. Hoping someone can help me understand what this means.   Thank you for help Barb Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Not sure why they need to remove radial scar bachambault MsPharoah
